sect1.title: Objectives
sect1.para: The Books Application is a project meant to get you familiar with the NEF development by creating a simple but complete and functional real world application. The Books Application deals with the user interface as well as the back end part of the application. This involves the database access and the implementation of business logic. The Books Application will lead you through everything it takes to get an actual application up and running with special focus on developing the SQL and data management layers of your application.

sect2.title: Learning Objectives Checklist
sect2.para: At the end of this tutorial, you should be able to understand:

listitem.para: how to set up the sample application
creation and testing of Data Layer
creation and testing of Presentation Layer

sect1.title: Assumptions
sect1.para: Following are the pre-requisites you need to work on the creation and testing of NEF based applications:

listitem.para: A Servlet Container (application server) supporting the Servlet 2.2 or higher specification

sect1.para: This tutorial also assumes your familiarity with XML, SQL, Java, Servlets and JDBC.

sect1.title: NEF Starter Application
sect1.para: For creation of a new NEF based application, you will need to download the Starter Application. The starter application is just an empty application that contains the minimal set of files required for NEF web applications. It doesn't do anything particularly useful but you can use this sample as your template for the new project.

sect2.title: Downloading the Starter Application
sect2.para: You can download the NEF Starter Application file from http://www.netspective.com/corp/downloads/frameworks/samples

sect2.title: Setting up the Starter Application
sect2.para: Copy the downloaded nefs-starter-empty.war file to the webapps folder of your servlet container (application server) and run (restart) the application server. This will create a folder structure containing the necessary NEF files and sub-folders under the webapps folder of the application server. You can access this Starter Application using the URL of the form http://host:port/nefs-starter-empty.
